column2: they did not have time to go to sleep before they heard a bear calling "Ugh! Ugh!" in the woods. They sprang up and ran out of the woods
column3: and just before they came to the bottom of the hill
column4: they saw right in front of them a beautiful little lake. They were not frightened any more
column5: for there in the water was something radiant and shining. "It is our own star
column6: said they, and it has come down to us." They never thought of looking up into the sky over their heads. It was enough for them that the star was in the water and so near them. But was it calling them? They thought so. "Come
column7: cried the brother, take my hand
column8: and we will go to the star." Then the spirit of the skies lifted them up gently and carried them away on a beautiful cloud.
